alert.note: Alert for Southern Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 20 at 2:34AM MDT until March 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 20 inches with locally higher amounts up to 30 inches in the Tushar Mountains and near Brian Head. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 16 to 28 inches possible with locally higher amounts in excess of 30 inches in the Tushar Mountains, Pine Valley Mountains, and near Brian Head. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph Tuesday night and Wednesday. * WHERE...Southern Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 9 PM MDT this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday morning through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx.
